results.firPara: History can turn on the seemingly least consequential of events. On 12 April 2015 Manchester United were leading Manchester City 4-1 at Old Trafford with three minutes remaining when Michael Carrick rolled an ankle on the touchline and limped off. Sergio Agüero pulled a goal back for City but of far more significance was that Carrick was ruled out for the rest of the season.
results.secPara: It was Uniteds sixth Premier League win in a row, a run in which they had beaten not only City but also Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur. It was the best they had played under Louis van Gaal. Everyone had been waiting for the click, the moment at which United assimilated his philosophy, the cogs aligned and fluency ensued, just as his Bayern Munich side had suddenly won 4-1 at Juventus in the group stages after months of unconvincing striving and had gone on to win the German double and reach the 2010 Champions League final. Was this Uniteds equivalent?
results.webTitle: Michael Carrick: Manchester United’s ageing but invaluable cog | Jonathan Wilson

results.firPara: • England captain recovers from knee problem sustained on international duty
results.secPara: José Mourinho has confirmed Wayne Rooney is available for Manchester United for Saturdays match against Arsenal, with the manager stating we know what didnt go well regarding his captain after the striker apologised for being photographed out late when on England duty.
results.webTitle: Manchester United’s Wayne Rooney fit to face Arsenal, says José Mourinho

results.firPara: With the World Cup in Russia looming ever closer, Euro 2016 has already faded into the familiar post-tournament haze, a flip chart of half-remembered moments. Goals from headers. Happy, well-adjusted Icelandic people. Cristiano Ronaldo close-ups. Roy Hodgson in a blazer looking noble and sad. David Guetta grinning and thrusting about behind his DJ plinth like the kind of uncle you have to keep an eye on at Christmas.
results.secPara: This week I was also reminded of the posters of smiling, face-painted fans Uefa slapped up around French city centres huge disembodied mugshots of supposed football supporters from every country, eyes wide, gripped with an apparently cloudless childlike ecstasy at their proximity to this celebration of the power of the brave new shining joy of our own global tomorrow-sport.
results.webTitle: China and Qatar: spendthrift would-be superpowers unlikely to reach Russia | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: • Manchester United manager compares himself to Arsenal counterpart
results.secPara: José Mourinho believes Arsène Wenger is afforded more respect than he does as they prepare for Saturdays meeting with Arsenal.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho: Arsène Wenger of Arsenal gets more respect than I do

results.firPara: Sporting Gijon have been ordered to partially close the south stand of their El Molinón stadium after alleged racist chanting from the home fans aimed at Athletic Bilbaos Iñaki Williams in August.
results.secPara: Spanish footballs disciplinary committee confirmed the punishment in a statement on Thursday, with Sporting indicating they will appeal against the unfair and disproportionate decision.
results.webTitle: Sporting Gijon ordered to partially close stand after alleged racist abuse

results.firPara: Gareth Southgate will be interviewed for the England managers post on Monday as the Football Association seeks to begin formal discussions over the appointment of Sam Allardyces permanent successor.
results.secPara: Southgate, who completed his four-match stint in interim charge with a draw against Spain at Wembley last week, also led England to victories against Malta and Scotland and a stalemate in Slovenia after being asked to step in to replace Allardyce.
results.webTitle: Gareth Southgate to be interviewed for England manager’s post on Monday

results.firPara: Philippe Coutinho has given Liverpool another fitness concern before Saturdays trip to Southampton after reporting back from international duty with a tight hamstring.
results.secPara: The in-form Brazil international underwent a scan at Liverpools Spire hospital on Thursday upon his return from playing in World Cup qualifying wins over Argentina and Peru.
results.webTitle: Liverpool wait on Philippe Coutinho’s scan results ahead of Southampton trip

results.firPara: IPCC says Sir Norman Bettisons book will not have significant adverse impact on ongoing criminal investigation
results.secPara: IPCC says Sir Norman Bettisons book will not have significant adverse impact on ongoing criminal investigation
results.webTitle: Police chief's Hillsborough book will not affect investigation, says watchdog
